package.name: ${ant.project.name}
package.description: This commands improves the default package command by the possibility to create Magento extensions and a command to initialize a new project to implement a Magento extension, and offers some tools used in the build / deployment process.

release.notes: Publish on GitHub
- Added targets for magento instance update from backup files.
- Bugfix in package2.xml due to renamed channel.url properties in build properties file.

- Added compatibilty for Windows - Added Template Setup class and Template sql upgrade script in mage-project stub generator. - Refactored build.default.properties and build.xml in mage-project stub generator.
- Fixed magento prefix bug in build.xml; prefix was also used for sample data
- Added configurable prefix for magento instance installation
- Removed deprecated phpunit-to-hudson.xsl - Fixed legacy "init" task to use new extract logic
- Fixed system.xml bug, namespace not correctly mentioned in config tab
- Marked Model, Resource Model and Block abstract classes correctly as abstract
- Added translate-handles for inclusion of translate csv files in config.xml
- Fixed duplicate content, explicit naming of $codepool contents in build.xml
- Fixed wrong class comment blocks in DummyTest.php
- Fixed DummyTest.php Integration in build.xml ant task run-tests

- Added several ant-targets to enable out of the box integration of newly generated modules into the Jenkins Continous Integration Suite
- phpmd: PHP Mess Detector - phpcpd: PHP Copy and Paste detection - phploc: PHP Lines of Code - phpcs: PHP Code Sniffer
- Fixed ant target pdepend for Jenkins integration
- Added PHPUnit DummyTest.php for correct Jenkins Integration
- Bugfix in Abstract Block Template: missing < before Namespace Tag

- Bugfix for Helper_Data / Helper_Config: Names were changed
- Removed direct config access via $this->getConfig vom abstract classes due to potential compatibility and stability issues. Config access now exclusively via e.g. Mage::helper('module/config')->getServiceUrl()
- Added code comments for PEAR_Command_Mage_ConfigHelperGenerator::_generate() and PEAR_Command_Mage_ConfigHelperGenerator::generateHelper()
- Fixed formating of nested if-statements in PEAR_Command_Mage_ConfigHelperGenerator::generateHelper()

(English version below)
DE:
- Als Lowercase Modul-Alias wird nun durchgängig [namespace]_[module] verwendet, also bspw. wmf_theme, anstatt wie zuvor nur [module], also bspw. nur "theme". Dies macht die Modulnamen eindeutiger.
- Das Tab für die Modul-Konfigurationssektion in der system.xml wird nun dynamisch anhand von [Namespace] und [namespace] generiert, anstatt wie zuvor immer fix "TechDivision" bzw. "techdivision" zu verwenden.
- Es wurde im Modul-Stub eine Klasse Helper/Config.php hinzugefügt, welche standardmäßig von der Abstrakten Config-Helperklasse ableitet, die wiederum automatisch beim Build und Deployment generiert wird.
- Es wurde ein PEAR-Command hinzugefügt, welches den Generierungsprozess des Abstract Config-Helpers ermöglicht.
- Es wurden in die Block, Model und ResourceModel Abstract-Klassen Funktionen zum Direktaufruf der Configuration eingefügt. Somit ist es standardmäßig möglich, in allen Modul-Blöcken, Models oder ResourceModels mittels bspw. $this->getConfig()->getServiceUrl() direkt und vor allem mit IDE-Unterstützung (da generiert, und nicht dynamisch als Magic-Method) auf die Konfigurationswerte lesend zuzugreifen.
- Die Konfigurationssektion "Allgemein" wurde zwecks Internationalisierung in "General umbenannt.
- Es wurden für de_DE sowie für en_US jeweils die locale-CSV- Dateien im Modul-Stub angelegt
EN: - The lowercase module alias is now consistently [namespace]_[module], instead of just [module] as before. This grants better uniqueness of names.
- The System-Config-Tab of the Module is now dynamically generated using [Namespace] and [namespace], instead of statically using TechDivision and techdivision
- The module stub has been extended by a class file Helper/Config.php, which does extend the abstract config helper classfile, which in turn will be automatically generated with each build / deploy.
- A PEAR-Command was added which generates the abstract config helper class
- Block and (Resource-)Model abstract classes have been extended with some functions to grant convenient access to the module's config helper, using statements like $this->getConfig()->getServiceUrl(). Moreover, as the helper class file is generated instead of dynamic with magic-methods, you can use the code-assist feature of your IDE to access config properties.
- The configuration section "Allgemein" has been renamed to "General" for internationalization reasons
- The folders app/locale/de_DE and app/locale/en_US have been added to the module stub, as well as two dummy CSV translation files
- Refactoring and updating projekt stub for mage-project command - Implementing codepool feature for mage-project command
- Bugfix create instance.tmp.dir before getting instance sources
- Enhanced mage-project stub generator for magento enterprise instance creation
- Bugfix in ContentsGenerator, now also correctly handles module directories with names meaning roles ("skin", "lib", etc..).
- Bugfix on changelog input message. Implementing standard value on return.
- Bugfix on changelog input message to be required
- Added release-version task to build.xml on mage-project stub
- Add missing method splitVersionRange() to class class.em_index.php
- Fixed shortcut on t3x-command
- Refactored mage-project command and project-stub
- Adding new Commands for creating a T3X-File and updating em_conf.php in TYPO3 Extensions
- Adding new Commands for updating em_conf.php in TYPO3 Extensions
- Adding new Commands for creating TYPO3 T3X-Files
- Bugfixing invalid buildpath - Refactoring package2.xml
- Adding new Command generate-contents to generate automatially contents node package2.xml
- Fixing bug to avoid copying wrong templates to target directory
- Removing version propery from build.xml - Switching to beta stability
- Adding licence to source templates - Refactoring PHPUnit TestSuite
- Adding new Command mage-project to create a new empty Extension
- Some fixes
